alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Bourbon; Boyle; Clark; Fayette; Garrard; Jessamine; Madison; Mercer; Nicholas; Scott; Washington; Woodford (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 8:48PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Garrard, southeastern Anderson, northern Clark, Jessamine, southern Nicholas, Mercer, Woodford, southern Scott, Bourbon, southeastern Washington, northern Boyle, northwestern Madison and Fayette Counties through 945 PM EST... At 848 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Georgetown to near Lawrenceburg to near Springfield. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lexington and Versailles around 855 PM EST. Georgetown around 900 PM EST. Dunbar High School around 905 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include U K Arboretum, Chevy Chase, Fayette Mall, Cardinal Hill, Northland, Meadowthorpe, Veterans Park, Highlands, Paris, Harrodsburg, Cadentown, Bryan Station, Thoroughbred Acres, Danville and Winchester. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Bourbon; Boyle; Clark; Fayette; Garrard; Jessamine; Madison; Mercer; Nicholas; Scott; Washington; Woodford
